Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, human cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (83.33%) toKR-12I: 17%, R=K: 25%.Activity:  active against Gram- E. coli KCTC 1682 (MIC 2 uM), P. aeruginosa KCTC 1637 (MIC 8 uM), S. typhimurium KCTC 1926 (MIC 1 uM), Gram+ B. subtilis KCTC 3068 (MIC 8 uM), S. epidermidis KCTC 1917 (MIC 1 uM), and S. aureus KCTC 1621 (MIC 2 uM). Warning: Non-standard assay.The peptide can also bind to LPS and show an anti-inflammatory effect (e.g., suppressing TNF-alpha).In vitro toxicity: human RBC (HC50 >800 uM), not hemo.lytic.Structure:  random coil in 10 mM PBS and helical in 0.1% LPS.
Literature Information.Author: Jacob B, Park IS, Bang JK, Shin SY. 2013
Literature Information.Title: Short KR-12 analogs designed from human cathelicidin LL-37 possessing both antimicrobial and antiendotoxic activities without mammalian cell toxicity.
